CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Enforcement proceedings;Article 6-1 - Access to court);Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions)
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Ján Šikuta;Johannes Silvis;Josep Casadevall;Luis López Guerra
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) ordered the ORG branch of the “ ORG ( “ the debtor ” ) , a predominantly socially - owned bank , to reinstate the applicant and to pay her outstanding salary and all work - related benefits for the period following her unlawful dismissal . That judgment became final on DATE .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date , the applicant filed a request for the enforcement of the above judgment . On DATE ORG issued a writ of execution ( rešenje o izvršenju ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was reinstated . However , as the debtor refused to pay the outstanding judgment debt , the applicant , on an unspecified date , filed a new request for the enforcement .

CARDINAL . On DATE , on the basis of a financial expert ’s analysis , ORG ordered the enforcement by debtor account transfer in the total amount of MONEY ( ORG ) in respect of salary arrears and all work - related benefits , for the period from DATE until DATE , together with statutory interest and ORG CARDINAL for legal costs .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested the court to change the means of enforcement as it appeared that there were no funds in the debtor ’s account . On DATE ORG ordered the enforcement by auctioning of the debtor ’s specified movable assets .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant obtained a pledge ( zalog ) over certain movable assets which were seized from the debtor ( CARDINAL vehicles and some technical equipment ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) instituted liquidation proceedings against the debtor .

CARDINAL . On DATE the enforcement proceedings were discontinued in view of the pending liquidation proceedings . On DATE the applicant reported her claims to the liquidation council ( likvidaciono veće ) .

CARDINAL . On several occasions thereafter , the applicant petitioned the court to continue with the enforcement and to schedule a public auction for the sale of the pledged assets , arguing that their value was decreasing due to the passage of time and that she had to bear the maintenance costs . On DATE she submitted the same request to the liquidation administrator ( likvidacioni upravnik ) .
CARDINAL . ORG held CARDINAL hearings concerning the applicant ’s requests , on DATE and DATE , but it would appear that no decision was issued .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , on DATE ORG appointed the ORG for Deposits as a liquidation administrator . On DATE ORG terminated the liquidation proceedings and opened bankruptcy proceedings against the debtor .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s claims against the debtor ( paragraph CARDINAL above ) and instructed her to initiate a new set of civil proceedings . On DATE the GPE High Commercial Court ( “ the High Commercial Court ” ) upheld that decision .
CARDINAL . The applicant did not initiate a new set of civil proceedings as instructed .
CARDINAL . It would appear that bankruptcy proceedings are still pending and that the debtor is still predominantly socially - owned .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is set out in the ORG ’s judgment of NORP GPE and Others v. GPE , nos . CARDINAL et al . , DATE .
